Title:
Diversity and molecular systematics of Fibroporia
(Polyporales, Basidiomycota)
Abstract:
In this study, phylogenetic analysis of DNA sequences of
multiple loci including the internal transcribed spacer (ITS) regions,
the large subunit nuclear ribosomal RNA gene (nLSU), the small subunit
nuclear ribosomal RNA gene (nSSU), the small subunit mitochondrial rRNA
gene sequences (mtSSU), the translation elongation factor 1-Î± gene
(tef1) and the second subunit of RNA polymerase II (rpb2) were carried
out. Combined with the morphological characters a new genus,
Pseudofibroporia gen. nov., is established. Three new species,
Fibroporia bambusae sp. nov. , Fibroporia ceracea sp. nov. and
Pseudofibroporia citrina sp. nov. are descibed from China. Illustrated
descriptions of the novel species are provided.
